maml:description.maml:para: Disables an Ethernet port on a network switch.
The Disable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort cmdlet disables an Ethernet port on a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet disables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a port to disable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet disables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies a port to disable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to an Ethernet port to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------ Example 1: Disable a port ------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Disable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -CimSession $Session -PortNumber 21

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
This command disables port 21 for NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 2: Disable a port by using a device ID --------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables an Ethernet port with device ID Ethernet17 on a network switch. The command uses a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables an Ethernet port on a network switch.
The Enable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort cmdlet enables an Ethernet port on a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet enables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a port to enable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet enables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies a port to enable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to Ethernet ports to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 1: Enable a port by using a device ID --------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Enable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -DeviceID "Ethernet17" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command enables ports for the device that has the ID Ethernet17 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 2: Enable a port by using a port number -------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables port 21. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets port information for a network switch.
The Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort cmdlet gets port information for a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet gets information for the port that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex disabled.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex enabled.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet gets the port that the parameter specifies.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet gets information for the port that this parameter specifies.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex disabled.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex enabled.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet gets the port that the parameter specifies.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 1: Get all the ports for a device ----------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command gets the ports for NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: ---------------- Example 2: Get a specific port ----------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -PortNumber 21 -CimSession $Session Name PortNumber DeviceID FullDuplex AutoSense PortType MaxDataSize ---- ---------- -------- ---------- --------- -------- ----------- Ethernet17 21 Ethernet17 True False 0 9214

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets port 21. The example shows the console output for the command. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 3: Get a port with a specified ID ----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the port for the device that has the ID Ethernet17. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an IP address from a port of a network switch.
The Remove-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress cmdlet removes an assigned IP address from a port of a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the number of a port. This cmdlet removes the IP address from the port that this parameter specifies.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies the number of a port. This cmdlet removes the IP address from the port that this parameter specifies.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove an IP address from a port by using the pipeline
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Remove-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress -CimSession $Session -PortNumber 21

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command removes the IP address of port 21 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the IP address on a port on a network switch.
The Set-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress cmdlet sets the IP address of an Ethernet port on a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies an IP address for the Ethernet port.
Specifies a subnet mask for the IP address.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies an IP address for the Ethernet port.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet sets the IP address on the port that this parameter specifies.
Specifies a subnet mask for the IP address.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies an IP address for the Ethernet port.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet sets the IP address on the port that this parameter specifies.
Specifies a subnet mask for the IP address.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that refer to an EthernetPort object.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 1: Assign an IP address to a port ----------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress -IpAddress "10.4.10.12" -PortNumber 21 -SubnetAddress "255.255.255.248" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command assigns an IP address and subnet address to the specified port by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the port mode on a network switch.
The Set-NetworkSwitchPortMode cmdlet sets the port mode to access, trunk or route on a network switch.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to access mode.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies the virtual local area network (VLAN) ID of the VLAN to set for the port in access mode.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies an IP address to set for the port in route mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to route mode.
Specifies the subnet mask to set for the port in route mode.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to trunk mode.
Specifies the VLAN IDs of the VLANs to set for the port in trunk mode.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to access mode.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies an IP address to set for the port in route mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to route mode.
Specifies the subnet mask to set for the port in route mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to trunk mode.
Specifies the virtual local area network (VLAN) ID of the VLAN to set for the port in access mode.
Specifies the VLAN IDs of the VLANs to set for the port in trunk mode.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to a network switch port to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: ------------- Example 1: Set a port to trunk mode -------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchPortMode -CimSession $Session -TrunkMode -VlanIDs 2,17,22

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second command sets NetworkSwitch08 to use trunk mode by using the $Session object. The command specifies IDs for three VLANs.

command:example.maml:title: ------------- Example 2: Set a port to route mode -------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the port to route mode. The command specifies its IP address and the subnet mask. The command includes a CimSession , similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the port properties for a network switch.

The Set-NetworkSwitchPortProperty cmdlet sets the port properties for a network switch. This cmdlet can modify any property. If you run this cmdlet, you must specify at least one property to change. Otherwise, the command returns an error.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: ------------- Example 1: Set properties for a port -------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> $PortSpeed = 1 PS C:\> $Description = "Port on management device 02." PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchPortProperty -CimSession $Session -Property @{Speed = $portSpeed; Description = $Description }

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type `Get-Help New-CimSession`.
The second and third commands assign values to the $PortSpeed variable and the $Description variable. These are the values of the key/value pairs.
The final command sets a properties by using the $Session object. The command uses standard syntax to create a hash table that contains the key/value pairs as the value of the Property parameter.
